intro: Lithospermum simplicissimum, commonly known as red root, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and small, blue or purple flowers. The plant produces a red, sticky resin that has been used traditionally in herbal medicine. Its roots are often harvested for their medicinal properties, including anti-inflammatory and antiseptic effects. Lithospermum simplicissimum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands.
